alignment_result.mapping_rationale: Both represent individuals using system functionality, but User is more generic while TeamMember is organizational-specific
alignment_result.notes: User represents individual consumer, TeamMember represents organizational member with roles and responsibilities

alignment_result.mapping_rationale: Both represent containers for multiple activities/tasks with progress tracking capabilities
alignment_result.notes: TodoList is generic task container, LearningPath is structured skill development sequence

conflicts_detected.description: Term 'User' overlaps conceptually with established 'TeamMember' but serves different domain contexts

resolution_options.description: Keep 'User' for personal productivity domain to distinguish from organizational 'TeamMember'
resolution_options.impact: Creates domain-specific terminology while preserving organizational standards

resolution_options.description: Define 'User' as a generalization of 'TeamMember' for broader contexts
resolution_options.impact: Extends organizational model with generic user concept

recommendations.description: Maintain 'User' terminology in personal productivity domain to distinguish from organizational 'TeamMember'
recommendations.impact: Preserves domain-specific clarity while avoiding confusion with organizational roles
recommendations.implementation: Document distinction between personal User and organizational TeamMember

recommendations.description: Consider adding LocalStorage concept to organizational technical architecture vocabulary
recommendations.impact: Enhances technical vocabulary for client-side persistence patterns
recommendations.implementation: Add LocalStorage and related technical persistence terms to organizational vocabulary

recommendations.description: Adopt completion operation naming pattern from organizational model
recommendations.impact: Improves consistency in operation naming across domains

recommendations.impact: Clarifies when to use personal vs organizational domain concepts
